clinical_study.brief_title: Coated Devices to Decrease Infection in the Intensive Care Unit
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Open-label Trial Assessing the Efficacy of a Bundle of Coated Devices to Reduce Nosocomial Infections in the Intensive Care Unit

brief_summary.textblock: Pilot explanatory, randomized, open label, controlled trial. Critically ill patients which will demand placement of invasive devices for organ support (endotracheal tube, central venous catheter and urinary Foley catheter) will be randomized 1:1 to receive coated (Bactiguard®) or habitual (non-coated) devices.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants recruited in each center during the trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants admitted to the intensive care unit that requires simultaneous insertion of endotracheal tube, central venous catheter and urinary catheter
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Assess how many patients admitted to the intensive care unit will demand insertion of endotracheal tube, urinary catheter and central venous catheter after admission in all patients
Occurrence of sepsis after admission in patients that require all three devices to be inserted in all patients

secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of sepsis after randomization (defined as infection plus organ failure)
Occurence of ventilator-associated pneumonia by radiographic and clinical criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurence of central venous catheter-related bloodstream infection
secondary_outcome.description: Occurence of central venous catheter-related bloodstream infection using Brazilian regulatory agency criteria
Occurence of urinary catheter-related infection defined as positive urinary culture coupled with fever and without any other infection source

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of composite endpoint of ventilator-associated pneumonia and/or central venous catheter-related bloodstream infection and/or urinary catheter-related infection
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of any of the infections above
Number of days not receiving antibiotics

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that die in Intensive Care Unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through intensive care unit stay, an average of 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality during intensive care unit stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that die during hospital stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through hospital stay, an average of 40 days

arm_group.description: Patients will receive endotracheal tube, central venous catheter and urinary cather coated with gold, silver and palladium (Bactiguard coating)
Shelf endotracheal tube, central venous catheter and urinary cather available at each intensive care unit without any type of coating designed to prevent infection

intervention.description: Gold-silver-palladium coated devices (endotracheal tube, central venous catheter and urinary catheter) will be used whenever necessary. All three devices are required to be inserted as soon as possible after randomization and need for all three devices are the main inclusion criteria
Devices without coating available at each participating intensive care unit
